TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CharRange extends DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Presentation.IndexRangeType

Docs.summary: Character Range. When the object is serialized out as xml, its qualified name is p:charRg.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlnoticeiso.md)] **charRg (Character Range)** This element specifies animation on a character range defined by a start and end character position. [*Example*: Consider animating the first word (characters 1 through 9) within a sentence. The \ element should be used as follows: ```xml ppt_x ppt_y ``` *end example*] |Parent Elements| |---------------------| |txEl (§19.5.91)| |Attributes|Description| |----------------|-----------------| |end (End)|This attribute defines the end of the index range.

The possible values for this attribute are defined by the *ST_Index* simple type (§19.7.3).| |st (Start)|This attribute defines the start of the index range.

The possible values for this attribute are defined by the *ST_Index* simple type (§19.7.3).| [*Note*: The W3C XML Schema definition of this element’s content model (CT_IndexRange) is located in §A.3. *end note*] [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlcopyrightiso.md)]
